Class Solver

  • java.lang.Object
    • Solver

  • public class Solver
extends java.lang.Object
    A 9x9 Sudoku Solver.

    This is an interpretation of a Sudoku Solver that was originally made by Dr. Peter Norvig.
    Like the original program, this solver also uses constraint propagation and depth-first search to find solutions for all Sudoku grids.

    Some terminology must be cleared up in order to understand how this class works:
    unit: A collection of nine squares that constitute a row, column or box in a sudoku grid.
    peer: All squares that share a unit.

    In his paper, Dr. Norvig talks about implementing human strategies into his solving algorithm.
    Mainly, these two provide the basis for the constraint propagation technique implemented here:
    1. If a square has only one possible number remaining, remove that number from its peers
    2. If a unit has only one possible place for a value, put it there

    Sources Used:
    Dr. Norvig's Sudoku Solver
    The GitHub page for the original code
    Using depth-first search for solving a Sudoku

      • solvePuzzle

        public long solvePuzzle(java.lang.String sudoku)
        Solves a sudoku puzzle and returns the time it took to solve it.
        Parameters:
        sudoku - An unsolved sudoku
        Returns:
        solve time, -1 if solving fails

      • solveFromFile

        public void solveFromFile(java.lang.String pathToFile)
                   throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                          java.io.FileNotFoundException
        Solves all sudoku puzzles that are in a file.
        Parameters:
        pathToFile - Path to file with Sudokus
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - specified file is not found
        java.lang.NullPointerException - file pathname is empty

      • solveFromFileAverage

        public void solveFromFileAverage(java.lang.String pathToFile,
                                 int iterations)
        Deprecated. Was used only for light benchmarking, not very necessary for the entire program
        Get an average of the solve time for each sudoku puzzle in the file.
        Parameters:
        pathToFile - Path to file with Sudokus
        iterations - Number of solving iterations per sudoku

      • displayGrid

        public void displayGrid()
        Displays the sudoku grid in graphical form

        Ex: (a solved sudoku) 
                9 8 6 | 3 2 4 | 1 5 7
        1 2 4 | 7 5 9 | 3 6 8
        5 3 7 | 8 6 1 | 4 2 9
        ------+-------+------
        4 1 3 | 2 8 5 | 9 7 6
        6 9 5 | 1 7 3 | 2 8 4
        2 7 8 | 9 4 6 | 5 1 3
        ------+-------+------
        3 4 2 | 6 1 7 | 8 9 5
        8 6 9 | 5 3 2 | 7 4 1
        7 5 1 | 4 9 8 | 6 3 2

      • displayInitialGrid

        public void displayInitialGrid()
        Displays an unsolved Sudoku (initialSudoku) in graphical form.

        Ex.) If an unsolved sudoku is represented like so,
        "4.....8.5.3..........7......2.....6.....8.4......1.......6.3.7.5..2.....1.4"
        it will be displayed like this: 
                4 . . | . . . | 8 . 5 
        . 3 . | . . . | . . . 
        . . . | 7 . . | . . . 
        ------+-------+------
        . 2 . | . . . | . 6 . 
        . . . | . 8 . | 4 . . 
        . . . | . 1 . | . . . 
        ------+-------+------
        . . . | 6 . 3 | . 7 . 
        5 . . | 2 . . | . . . 
        1 . 4 | . . . | . . .
        with empty squares represented by periods (.).

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
